cells

Class BehaviorCell

  • java.lang.Object
    • cells.Cell
      • cells.BehaviorCell
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MockCell

    public class BehaviorCell
extends Cell
    Flexible cell class capable of performing arbitrary bottom-up (agent-driven) behaviors for agent-based modeling.

    Created by David B Borenstein on 1/25/14.

      • apply

        public void apply()
        Description copied from class: Cell
        Applies changes to the cell. DO NOT CALL THIS METHOD DIRECTLY FROM A PROCESS. Instead, use lattice.apply().
        Specified by:
        apply in class Cell

      • divide

        public Cell divide()
        Description copied from class: Cell
        Instructs the cell to divide and returns the daughter cell. This triggers any division-related behaviors.

        DO NOT CALL THIS METHOD DIRECTLY FROM A PROCESS. Instead, use lattice.divide().

        Specified by:
        divide in class Cell
        Returns:

      • clone

        public Cell clone(int childState)
        Description copied from class: Cell
        Creates an exact replica of the cell, differing only by the state value. Copies all internal state variables. Does not trigger any division-related events or changes.
        Specified by:
        clone in class Cell
        Returns:

        Description copied from class: Cell
        Returns the current production of the specified solute.
        Specified by:
        getProduction in class Cell
        Parameters:
        solute - the ID of the solute layer associated with the solute whose production is to be checked.
        Returns:

      • adjustFitness

        public void adjustFitness(double delta)
        Description copied from class: Cell
        Informs the cell that it has been given a direct benefit. The effect of this benefit depends on the cell class.
        Specified by:
        adjustFitness in class Cell

      • trigger

        public void trigger(java.lang.String behaviorName,
           Coordinate caller)
        Description copied from class: Cell
        Triggers a behavior associated with the cell. The specific details of the behavior are defined by the cell's class. As of 1/24/2014, only the BehaviorCell class will have an instantiated trigger(...) method; other classes of cells will throw an UnsupportedOperationException.
        Specified by:
        trigger in class Cell
        Parameters:
        behaviorName - the name of the behavior to trigger.
        caller - the coordinate of the triggering site. If invoked from a top-down Process, the caller will be null.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        A BehaviorCell is equal to another Object if and only if: - The other Object is a BehaviorCell. - The other Object has a division threshold equal to this one. - The other Object has a state ID equal to this one. - The other Object has a dispatcher that reports equality with this cell's dispatcher.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        See Also:
        BehaviorDispatcher

      • getThreshold

        public double getThreshold()
